name: astragalus

astragalus noun
(PLANT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U, U ] a plant, especially from China, Mongolia, and Korea, used as a medicine to strengthen the body's immune system: Astragalus helps assist wellness during sinusitis and colds.
More examplesFewer examplesAstragalus is used in traditional Chinese medicine in combination with other herbs.Some research shows that taking astragalus by mouth can improve some measures of heart function in people with chest pain.Astragalus sinicus is grown in rice fields before being ploughed under for rice cultivation.

astragalus noun
(BONE)
[ C ]
  anatomy
  specialized plural astragali uk/əˈstræɡ.ə.li/ us/əˈstræɡ.ə.li/ a bone in the foot of a person or animal that connects the two leg bones in the ankle joint: The bones of the leg can move freely over the surface of the astragalus, which forms the roller of the hinge. Synonyms
talus
tarsus
More examplesFewer examplesThe medical name for the ankle-bone is the astragalus.The astragalus is fused to the tibia in the two preserved specimens of Polacanthus. The paper describes a method for predicting paleohabitats using measurements of bovid astragali.
